title: Great dosbox port but
comment: This app works great and almost flawlessly especially on my Tablet.  though one complaint I has with, which I think maybe not the fault of the app, is that ctrl,esc, Function keys on bluetooth keyboard don't work with dosbox.  I read that this is from android OS special keys, I read it is possible to solve at least on rooted devices, but haven't had luck.  I hope the app developer can find way and take advantage of root permission to make dosbox respond to function keys and ctrl.   one other feature I hope to see is a reset option, that restart dosbox after confirmation.   the work around I do for ctrl and esc keys I set them in on-screen keys, but it is not ideal solution.

title: Keyboard won't work
comment: I tried a few different keyboards on my Samsung Ace II, but I could not input any  text. A shame because I like using this program on my laptop.

title: Eh.

title: Great port, needs traditional touch mouse support.
comment: An awesome android port of an awesome program, only truly hampered by it's lack of normal touch screen navigation for the mouse in games. The app currently implements the touchscreen as a trackpad, but a true touch mouse experience would make this great app amazing. I recommend Hackers keyboard for the best typing experience in aDosBox.

title: Keyboard issues
comment: The first time I used this my virtual keyboard didn't work. The second time it worked, but blocked half the screen so that I couldn't see anything I was typing. I tried to turn on keyboard transparency, but it did absolutely nothing. Even after I exited DosBox, the keyboard remained. This however was solved by tapping the home button.   Bottom line: NEEDS WORK.

title: Keyboard only allows one alpha key entry at a time

To input 'dir' you have to open the keyboard, enter 'd' then close the keyboard, then open it again for 'i' and the same for 'r'.  The problem only applies to alpha keys. Numerics can be input with no problem.

title: Sony Xperia Acro S LT6w (LT26w)
comment: Плюсы: полноценный MS-DOS, возможность установки Microsoft Windows на Google Adroid, (корявая) настройка управления включая клавиши для полупрозрачного экранного touch-pad-а, корректная работа с HDMI. Минусы: редкие обновления, стабильно вылетает после попытки сохранить конфигурацию, часто - при тапе двумя пальцами, глюки при попытке отображения картинки с соотношением сторон картинки 4:3 без растягивания, нет multi-touch, нет настройки расположения кнопок touch-pad-а, при отсутствии copy-paste и стрелок в дефолтовой клавиатуре и на touch-pad-е работа в консоли - мученье, в Windows 3.1 и соответственно запущенном под ней Doom 2 нет звука. Черный экран после возвращения из настроек клавиатуры (Flit Extra layout), требует разрешения использовать сетевой обмен данными.

title: Good
comment: Great but please add support for physical keyboard & portrait view

title: Mouse control needs urgent fix
comment: On my Galaxy SL (1.0 Ghz, Android 2.3.4) the mouse has a totally RANDOM behaviour. I tried all mouse modes and restarted, they are the same, the mouse is pressed only when it wants, or it remains in a contantly-pressed manner that its impossible to undo. Also, the game I tried, SimCity2000, runs extremely slow and with very choppy sound. Changing CPU cycles is useless, it does nothing. Ony frameskip set to 10 made it less laggy but still unplayable.  The keyboard and mouse configuration needs to be rebuilt, you can't be asking to set the keys and buttons every time. Please make a decent configuration options menu, instead of using dialogs (they are not for this, they are for alerts and Yes/No questions). Apart from that, it seems a very promising product. But mouse and performance issues must be addressed for Galaxy phones at least.

title: Not bad...
comment: Runs several things like a charm. I only have a few minor complaints: The virtual keyboard covers the screen. I agree with the portrait mode. I'd like a way to place my thumbs between the virtual buttons. So used to analog sticks. The "align mouse" isn't working in my Win3.1 install. GoT keeps crashing DB about a minute in. I'd absolutely love to be able to change the C:\ directory to something other than the SDCard directory. Other than the above, keep up the awesome work!

title: One little addition..

title: Horrible performance, completely useless
comment: This used to be a nice try and a basic method to get acquainted with DOSBox on an Android device, but it's almost useless in comparison to other competitors. Right, it's free, but that's the only good thing about it. Other ports are MUCH faster (Doom timedemo3 in aDOSBox: 21074 tics; in DOSBox Turbo: 3104 tics). aDOSBox crashes every now an then, and it does not "exit gracefully" as described in the "What's new" section when closing, but freezes and then crashes to desktop after a while (according to aLogcat report). Onscreen controls are tedious and features are limited, everything seems very raw and, well, beta (that's what it is, after all). On the whole, sluggish performance is THE deal breaker for aDOSBox. And it doesn't look as if this port is being developed any further, so I don't expect any updates or at least a final release state anymore.

title: review for TF101
comment: installed this to try and get simcity 2000 running, and it runs...   but a fairly major gripe I have is that when docked I set up adosbox to have a trackball so I could use the dock's touchpad. the touchpad on the dock only works when i have two fingers pressed down. When I do this however, it interprets a left mouse click so it makes playing games that require a mouse virtually impossible. the same problem occurs when using a physical mouse, I need to hold down left mouse button for the mouse to move and a left click is registered. and of course because it is emulating the mouse I see two mouse pointers on screen. it makes it a bit difficult to use the mouse. if you could work on compatibility for ACTUAL mice to control the mouse pointer it would be greatly appreciated.   one other problem is that the onscreen keyboard doesn't move the bottom of the screen up, so you can't see what you are typing into the dos prompt.  others have complained about the inability to rotate the screen so I'll throw that in as a desired feature too.   apart from those gripes it does what it's supposed to do and I'm chuffed with it. a great little beta, here's hoping you keep up the good work.

For HTC Evo 3D users not being able to open the on screen keyboard: Press and hold the menu button, then try to open the keyboard.

For those that need a better shell, just donload 4DOS or NDOS and run it on top of DosBox.	Great program a even a better price.

title: Fantastic!
comment: Works perfectly on Iconia Tab a500, works even better with USB keyboard. Most games run fine but some of the "heavy" games like Duke 3d don't run well, I might just need to do some tweaking though to make them work as the Tecra chipset shouldn't have any issues. will enjoy watching this app mature.
Works better than the one I paid for
Great app i was running win 3.1 within minutes.

title: Great
comment: Excellent APP for playing classic adventure DOS based games.. brought back the good old days of gaming...so Far all Dynamix games have worked perfectly on aDosBox
tons of features but force closes on exit some stability issues great app overall
Seems to run great - but no mouse support, so i cant really tell. Will rate 5 stars when mouse support is added :)
Runs very slow on my phone but it's a thrill seeing Windows 3.1 running on a cell phone!

title: Awesome!
comment: Works great on my droid x
Fantastic app! Works exactly like dosbox! Only thing that would make this better is key mapping.
I got windows on here

title: Excellence
comment: Works beautifully on Galaxy S. Been able to play the Commander Keen series, Duke Nukem I, Crystal Caves, Xargon, Jazz Jackrabbit and a few other of my favourite dos games. Sound effects often lag by a second or two (depending on the game), though they aren't distorted or anything so I guess its a configuration issue on my end. I've installed and attempted to run a few other Dos emulator apps, but this is by far the most functional.
I wish it was possible to reconfigure the on-screen controls. Playing Ultima V on a G2. Hardware ALT key doesn't work with this.

title: No onscreen keyboard....
comment: but the flipping joystick works! HTC Desire HD android 2.3.3
I need just a little bit more. My on screen keyboard doesn't work anymore. Was awesome before it broke. HTC tbolt das bamf remix 1.7
would be useful with F1-12 keys & ctrl key
Brilliant. Free and fast. This is the fastest by far but the sound is not as good, high cycles will give choppy sound.
I'm running Windows 3.11 on my phone! After some calibration, the mouse is functional but don't expect to play windows games.
Love it! Runs daggerfall surprisingly well.
Great app. It would be better if there are F1-12, alt, ctrl keys.
Having a lot of fun with this. Wonderful nostalgia! The mouse is a little cumbersome, it would be better if it snapped to touch.
Definitely going the right way. A second button configuration for games would be nice, as well as being able to move the joystick. Volfied runs great!
Great app! Some games dont work though, and the quit button doesnt work either.

title: Portrait mode?
comment: How the heck do I get it to switch?! I want to try this, but being forced into landscape AND an onscreen keyboard makes it pretty worthless. I was happy to use my Galaxy Tab's keyboard dock for long-term play... but if I can't put the display into portrait mode, this obviously won't work!
Needs a little more devolpment...dont run c n c red alert
Works awesomely, but needs support for alt keys! When that's in, this app will get 5* !!!
Crashes to desktop on load. Samsung Captivate. Could be a conf setting but no way to change options.
Looking very good so far. Mouse not working for me either. Would like to see the ability to get to the options/menu. Only appeared when installed.
Nice work. The touchscreen calibration option did not seem to do anything on my galaxy p1000. But other than that the screen resolution etc was 100%
Great work so far! Galaxy tab 7". I can't get the mouse to work around the whole screen; 2 do this I use accelerometer + laptop mouse, but it sucks...
Awesome app, can play dos games like; Alone in the dark. Would also like support for alt key. (^3^)
Could do with the ability to remove the touchscreen D-pad as it gets in the way of certain games. Other than that pretty good HTC desire
Awesome try, but it doesn't recognize any of my alt keys, and i cant pull up the virtual kb, so i cant even change drives. :( Sidekick 4g
Could be mapped better for G2 keyboard. I saw that someone had done a version online with it mapped for G2 but " and : dont work.
Doom works, slowly. I boosted CPU cycles but hit a wall at around 6k. Looking forward to improved performance. Incredible CM 7.0.2.1
As fast as other dosbox ports on the market. The software keyboard doesnt seem to work for me, but a hardware keyboard works fine. Good job!
Works perfectly with my favorite games... rogue and xenon 2!!!!!
Works perfect for what I wanted. I can now play ADOM on my Droid 2 perfectly.
